intro: Rauvolfia mayombensis, commonly known as Mayombensis Rauvolfia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species known for their medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its roots and stems contain alkaloids, which have been studied for potential pharmaceutical applications. Due to its habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and less-known species within the Rauvolfia genus.
